oai_dc:dc.dc:title: English-made, double-barrelled shotgun
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Schneider & Glassick, a Memphis-manufactory, modified this Birmingham, UK-made piece for cavalry use. Under orders from the Memphis Ordnance Dept., this firm alterred in 1861 the barrells and cones and added a ring for use by cavalry. It was said that Gen. Nathan Bedford Forrest encouraged his cavalrymen, many of whom were from west Tennessee, to carry shotguns.
